content.question: A. On the diagram, draw an arrow to show the direction of electron flow in the wire.

frqParts.text: A. On the diagram, draw an arrow to show the direction of electron flow in the wire.
B. Use the half-reactions in the table to write the balanced net ionic equation for the reaction that occurs in the electrolytic cell.

C. Calculate the average current, in <math alttext="Coulombs per second" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C/s</mtext></math>, that must flow through the cell to produce <math alttext="0.18 gram" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.18</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of lithium metal in <math alttext="3200, decimal point," overflow="scroll"><mn>3200.</mn></math> seconds.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
